pageContext.claim: “Great for the farmers, it'll [USMCA] bring tens of thousands of new jobs to Michigan, it'll bring hundreds of thousands of new jobs to our country and we won't be ripped off like we were.”
pageContext.analysis: These are absurd numbers. No analysis made such claims. The U.S. International Trade Commission estimated a gain of 176,000 jobs from the USMCA, roughly the number of jobs created in a month during the pre-pandemic economy. Another study found that employment would remain fixed. Trump's Labor Department concluded "the sizes of the effects are modest reflecting the narrow scope the Agreement has in the context of the very large and mostly domestic-facing U.S. economy."
